channel.title: Php variables
channel.description: well, since an unsigned long variable in VB can't handle it, I would just like to have it echo a variable some how of a loop of 7304 times of a variable starting at 1 and multiplying itself by 2 every time. or you could just give me the number.. can someone help me?

item.title: Php variables
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

If I remember right, PHP’s limitations with integers and floats are platform-dependent.

Read full topic

item.title: Php variables
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

yeah, and it is a big number but even an unsigned(wont go negative, so it adds how many negative values to the positive values) 64 bit number variable can’t hold it. Unless someone knows how make a 1024 unsigned bit variable, I don’t know if I will ever know the answer

Read full topic

item.title: Php variables
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

Change

echo $x;

to

echo $x . “
”;

(For starters, I mean.)

And as far as “INF” goes, my guess is that you’re hitting a wall, multiplying exponentially like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Php variables
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:2, topic:121903”]I think i know what you mean, i’ll give it a shot. Maybe you can work off it?
(Not tested, so forgive me if there’s errors)

<?php
  $x = 1;
  for ($i=0;$i<7304;$i++){
    $x = $x * 2;
    echo $x;
  }
?>

Something like that?[/quote]
with the script i made it returned infinite and with your it returns…

well nevermind just goto www.therealjdb.org/math.php

its too long to insert into here, but look through it to around the end.

Read full topic

item.title: Php variables
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

I think i know what you mean, i’ll give it a shot. Maybe you can work off it?
(Not tested, so forgive me if there’s errors)

<?php
  $x = 1;
  for ($i=0;$i<7304;$i++){
    $x = $x * 2;
    echo $x;
  }
?>

Something like that?

Read full topic
